Key Arguments: The legislation will damage free speech, which is a non-negotiable human right.
The definition of 'misinformation' as causing harm, including psychological harm, is too subjective.
Governments cannot effectively police subjective interpretations of harm.
There is a trend of increasing restrictions on speech in Australia, and this bill is an extreme example.
Notable Quotes: Free speech is a non-negotiable human right and must be safeguarded.
It is simply not possible for governments to police such subjectivity.
